intro: Neocussonia lukwangulensis, commonly known as the Lukwangulensis Cossonia, is a rare plant species native to the Democratic Republic of the Congo. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical rainforests. Its flowers are small and clustered, often displaying a mix of white and pink hues. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered a vulnerable species.
